availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
16
The Governor accepted the resignations of H. H. Culbertson W. H. Cressy, Jos C. Bailey & W. G. Stone, Capt. 1st 2d & 3d Lieut of the Woodford Blues

Jany 16
The Governor approved an account of $87.50/100 for the Services of three guards at State Arsenal certified as correct by the Qr Mr Genl.

He issued a Proclamation ordering an election in the county of Warren for Representative in the General Assembly made vacant by the resignation of P. Hines -- Setting forth Saturday Jany. 26th as the day for said election.
He approved the following accounts, to wit

row.cell: sundries furnished Q. M Genl Dept.

body.p: All duly certified by the Qr Mr General as correct
